book_name: An Elegant Puzzle - Systems of Engineering Management - by Will Larson.pdf
summary: In this chapter, we explore the importance of focusing on policy rather than exceptions in organizational management. When exceptions arise due to the constraints of existing policies, they should be documented and treated as valuable insights for policy revisions. By embracing escalations as test cases, organizations can ensure a consistent and fair environment for all. It is crucial to set a future date for policy evaluations to avoid premature modifications based on concerns. Ultimately, this approach fosters trust and efficiency, allowing teams to operate smoothly while continuously improving policies.

slides.section_body: To foster a productive work environment, shift your focus from constantly addressing exceptions to refining your organizational policies. This proactive approach prevents the erosion of your efforts and enhances team trust. Remember, exceptions can reveal critical areas for improvement in your existing frameworks.
slides.quote: Stop working the exceptions, and instead work the policy.

slides.section_body: When exceptions arise, instead of rushing to amend policies, document the issues experienced. This practice allows for a comprehensive review and ensures you don’t lose sight of the broader policy framework. It’s not just about fixing; it’s about understanding the underlying challenges.
slides.quote: Commit to refreshing the policy in a month, and batch all exceptions requests until then.

slides.section_body: Every escalation should be treated as a test case to reassess your constraints. By gathering these instances, you can effectively analyze the gaps between policy and practice. This process helps in evolving the policies to better serve the organization’s needs.
slides.quote: Collect every escalation as a test case for reconsidering your constraints.

slides.section_body: Set a future date for reviewing your policies post-rollout. It allows you to observe the effects without the pressure of immediate change. This method helps in maintaining effective policies while providing a scheduled time for necessary adjustments.
slides.quote: Declare a future time when you’ll refresh it to evaluate new policy effects.

slides.section_body: Be cautious not to alter effective policies based on temporary concerns. This can lead to unnecessary changes that disrupt the intended impact. Stability during the evaluation phase is essential for meaningful insights into policy effectiveness.
slides.quote: At a sufficiently high rate of change, policy is indistinguishable from exception.

slides.section_body: A consistent approach to policy and exception handling fosters trust within your team. When team members know that their feedback will lead to comprehensive evaluations, they will feel valued and empowered to communicate challenges.
slides.quote: Ensure that escalations are inputs for updated policy, not handled in a one-off fashion.

slides.section_body: By encouraging escalations as a standard practice, you allow team members to voice frustrations without disrupting organizational flow. This structured feedback mechanism serves as a release valve, facilitating a healthier working environment.
slides.quote: This approach creates a release valve for folks who are frustrated with rough edges in your current policies.

slides.section_body: It’s important to see escalations as opportunities for refinement rather than just problems to be fixed. This mindset shift encourages a culture of continuous improvement, strengthening overall policy effectiveness over time.
slides.quote: Instead of ignoring escalations, use them to merge challenges into new revisions.

slides.section_body: Working the policy instead of exceptions can save time and energy for leadership. By focusing on effective policy formulation, management can engage more productively with teams rather than serving as judges for exceptions.
slides.quote: Move from working the exceptions to working the policy.

slides.section_body: Ultimately, policies should evolve to reflect the realities of the organization. By iteratively updating policies based on real-world challenges, organizations ensure they remain relevant and responsive to their team’s needs.
slides.quote: Ensure that policies adapt to the challenges discovered in practice.
